intro: Acer mono f. savatieri, commonly known as the Japanese maple with variegated leaves, is a decorative shrub or small tree native to Japan. It is a cultivar of the species Acer mono, characterized by its striking variegated foliage that features white and yellow patterns on green leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and has a compact, rounded shape. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained, acidic soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
